item.description: Andrew remains the subject of a mystery many are flummoxed by. The king's brother has not had a paid job for large chunks of his life, yet somehow he has managed to fund a luxury lifestyle.

Now, Khawaja and other athletes have agreed to form a Players' Coalition to influence policy change on issues ranging from racism and human rights to social media abuse.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: How hitchhiking 'suckerfish' reveal humpback whales' 'web of life'
item.description: Suckerfish, the ocean's ultimate hitchhikers, cling to humpback whales for thousands of kilometres and reveal surprising insights into life on the whale highway.

item.title: Boy dies, man injured in mango farm quad bike crash south of Darwin
item.description: An 11-year-old boy has died in a quad bike crash that also injured a 38-year-old man at a mango farm south of Darwin.

item.title: Australia's Kimberly Birrell loses Chennai Open final but earns sportsmanship award
item.description: Gold Coast tennis star Kimberly Birrell loses in the Chennai Open final but claims a sportsmanship award for touching moment.

item.title: Sam Kerr and Ellie Carpenter score for Chelsea as manager praises impact of Matildas
item.description: Matildas Sam Kerr and Ellie Carpenter both score for Chelsea in an impressive performance from the Australian stars.

item.title: Maternal health forum reveals gaps in NT system, families choosing to move interstate
item.description: Women who have had traumatic birth experiences at Royal Darwin Hospital have gathered to share their stories and call for urgent action from the territory and federal governments.

item.title: Magnitude-6.3 earthquake hits Afghanistan
item.description: It is unclear how many people have died following an earthquake in northern Afghanistan, two months after a tremor killed more than 2,200 people.

item.title: Rescues on Bluff Knoll increase fourfold in one year as visitor numbers rise
item.description: About 50,000 people climb Bluff Knoll in WA's Stirling Range each year, and emergency services say they are being called to more rescues as hikers underestimate the challenging track.

item.title: New York Marathon won by Benson Kipruto in classic photo finish, Eliud Kipchoge announces final tour
item.description: Benson Kipruto holds off a fast-finishing Alexander Mutiso to win the New York Marathon by 0.2 seconds, while Hellen Obiri breaks the course record to win the women's race.

item.title: Italian Alps avalanche kills five Germans, including father and daughter
item.description: The avalanche struck the German climbers as they headed for the summit of Cima Vertana about 4pm on Saturday at an altitude of more than 3,500 metres.

item.title: What time is the Melbourne Cup? How to watch and the weather forecast
item.description: Rain in Melbourne is set to play a factor in Australia's most famous horse race, with Flemington Racecourse predicted to be rated a Soft 7 or Heavy 8 for Tuesday's Melbourne Cup.

item.title: NRL and RLPA to investigate Eli Katoa handling after Tonga star suffered 'seizure activity' during New Zealand Test match
item.description: The Storm say Eli Katoa had surgery after suffering "seizure activity" following multiple head knocks in the Tonga and New Zealand clash, and the league and players' association are set to investigate.

item.title: Charges laid after 'trail of destruction' and rock thrown at firefighters in regional SA
item.description: Three arrests have been made in two separate incidents in regional South Australia, one in which a man allegedly lit a fire before throwing a rock at firefighters and another involving a car being discovered in flames after allegedly leaving a "trail of destruction" on a property.

item.title: Father of Molly Ticehurst frustrated by court delays in murder case
item.description: The father of murdered childcare worker Molly Ticehurst breaks down while expressing his frustration at the delays in the case against her alleged killer.

item.title: ATSB report finds communication failures led to Maersk ship smashing into Leeuwin II
item.description: A lack of effective communication contributed to a collision between the sail training ship Leeuwin II and a container ship in Fremantle Harbour last year that injured two crew members, a new report has found.

item.title: Mental health reform needed to stop children ending up in prison, doctors say
item.description: As incarceration rates continue to soar in the Northern Territory, experts say mental health reform in the justice system is crucial for improving community safety in the long term.

item.title: Melbourne hoping for chance to face undefeated North Melbourne in AFLW finals
item.description: North Melbourne may be undefeated for the second home and away season in a row, but a star Melbourne player says the short AFLW season means they haven't proven themselves against everyone.

item.title: Dark Mofo sees drop in interstate visitors despite return of full program
item.description: Tasmania's provocative midwinter festival Dark Mofo will return in 2026, as this year's festival reports fewer interstate visitors as "budgets are tightening" across the country.

item.title: Bathurst childcare worker sentenced over head injury to four-year-old
item.description: The Bathurst childcare worker is said to have used "considerable force" on the child, resulting in his head needing medical adhesive.

item.title: Optus held 11 crisis meetings before telling government about triple-0 deaths
item.description: A Senate grilling of Optus executives reveals the company sat on information about deaths resulting from its triple-0 outage for nearly a day before telling the public.

item.title: Review of mass salmon mortalities in Tasmania points to litany of failures
item.description: The state's environment watchdog has released a debrief of lessons and reflections from a mass salmon mortality event in which dead fish washed up on Tasmanian beaches.

item.title: Alice Springs lashed by 'fierce' storm and wild wind, cutting power
item.description: A severe thunderstorm brought down trees and cut power for several hours in Alice Springs.

item.title: Alleged manslaughter victim resorted to eating from school bins, court told
item.description: A girl who died, allegedly as a result of criminal neglect by her mother, had resorted to eating food out of bins at her school, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm.

item.title: What led to the giant, damaging hail which smashed parts of Queensland over the weekend?
item.description: Hailstones of up to 8 and 9 centimetres hit parts of Queensland over the weekend. What caused them to be so large?

item.title: Donald Trump renovates White House Lincoln bathroom with marble and chandelier over toilet
item.description: The US president says the new look is more appropriate than the "Art Deco green tile style" from the last renovation in the 1940s.

item.title: Jennifer Mui Len Chin avoids jail after stabbing daughter's boyfriend in her home
item.description: A Perth mother who stabbed her daughter's teenage boyfriend when she found him semi-naked in the family home avoids a prison sentence.

item.title: Brief of evidence in Pheobe Bishop murder case reissued due to server crash
item.description: Thousands of pages of evidence had to be reissued to defence team after it was lost in server crash.

item.title: Your rights when it comes to breastfeeding and expressing at work
item.description: There are many ways to combine breastfeeding and paid work, for example expressing milk, breastfeeding during breaks, or working from home. Knowing your rights can help you feel more confident when negotiating what that looks like.

item.title: Ash Barty urges Australians to be patient with tennis young guns Emerson Jones and Maya Joint
item.description: Australia's last women's singles grand slam champ is encouraged by the new crop of kids coming through, but has urged fans to remain patient with their progress.

item.title: Former SA opposition leader David Speirs shares ideas for algal bloom recovery
item.description: Former South Australian opposition leader David Speirs says he will make a decision about his political future in the coming weeks as he launches his own plans for the algal bloom.

item.title: Outspoken Mexican mayor known for anti-crime stance killed during Day of the Dead festivities
item.description: In recent months Mayor Carlos Alberto Manzo Rodríguez had publicly appealed to the Mexican president for help to combat cartel violence and organised crime.

item.title: Mid North Coast blueberry farmer counts losses after severe storm
item.description: Stephen Thandi says a storm tore through his northern New South Wales blueberry farm "like a freight train" at the weekend, causing at least at least $300,000 worth of damage.

item.title: Labor pledged to ban nuclear weapons in opposition. In government it got a reality check
item.description: Anthony Albanese and Richard Marles once pledged Labor would sign a treaty to ban nuclear weapons. Why have they walked this back in government?

item.title: US judge ends Justin Baldoni lawsuit against Blake Lively for missing court deadline
item.description: The actor's lawsuit against his co-star Blake Lively ends after he missed a court deadline on October 17 to file an amended complaint.

item.title: Gold Coast Mayor Tom Tate calls for urgent e-transport law changes after deaths of two children
item.description: Following the deaths of a 15-year-old and an eight-year-old in the space of less than two days, Gold Coast Mayor Tom Tate calls for urgent change to Queensland laws.

item.title: CCTV footage of alleged kidnapping of George Ayoub
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Police investigate Sydney developer's brother's alleged kidnapping, claim $1 million ransom paid
item.description: George Ayoub was allegedly taken and shoved into the back of a car while he was walking outside his Belfield home about 5am on Thursday.

item.title: Hinchinbrook by-election a 'test' for Queensland LNP government as writs issued
item.description: One year after sweeping to power, Queensland's LNP government will face voters at the Hinchinbrook by-election, with the poll seen as a test for the premier.

item.title: Melbourne's delayed Fishermans Bend redevelopment labelled 'biggest planning failure in Australia's history'
item.description: It has been touted as "Australia's largest urban renewal project" right next to one of the country's biggest CBDs. But critics say the development is being held back.

item.title: Gorden Tallis and Matthew Johns join Gold Coast Titans ownership group under Frizelle family
item.description: Former Broncos captain Gorden Tallis joins interstate rivals as a part-owner alongside former Knights playmaker Matthew Johns.

item.title: Liberals shifting towards dumping net zero, despite moderate faction fears
item.description: The centre of debate inside the Liberals appears to be shifting towards dumping net zero, as a tumultuous debate unfolds following the Nationals' decision to formally abandon the 2050 target.

item.title: Trial begins for man charged with murder over alleged hit and run at Browns Plains in Logan
item.description: Umar Al Enizi is charged with the murder of Troy Vandenberg in September 2021. The jury heard both men were "total strangers" who had been involved in an altercation.

item.title: Teenager avoids conviction over 'racist' attack on security guard at Bendigo Marketplace
item.description: A teenager involved in the violent attack on a security guard that forced a country Victorian shopping centre into lockdown avoids jail.

item.title: Coral Adventurer had mechanical problems ahead of passenger Suzanne Rees's death
item.description: Passengers have left the the ill-fated Coral Adventurer following the death of Suzanne Rees. Ongoing mechanical problems have cut the journey short and the ship is returning south from the Torres Strait.

item.title: 6.3 earthquake damages Afghanistan's historic Blue Mosque
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Donald Trump says UK royals suffered 'terrible thing' with pressure over Jeffrey Epstein scandal
item.description: Donald Trump says he felt badly for the British royal family after King Charles stripped his brother Andrew Mountbatten Windsor of his title as prince amid mounting pressure over his ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Suspected meteor spotted in afternoon sky across Victoria's Gippsland region
item.description: Victorians living in the state's Gippsland region say they saw a streak of light whizzing through the Sunday afternoon sky and heard a sonic boom, with many wondering if they saw space junk or a meteor.

item.title: Chinese ship spies on Australia, Philippines and the US in South China Sea
item.description: A sophisticated Chinese spy ship monitors Australian, Philippines, United States and New Zealand naval forces as they conduct another round of joint exercises in the South China Sea.

item.title: Champion trainer Chris Waller compares Buckaroo to 2021 Melbourne Cup champ Verry Elleegant
item.description: Buckaroo might have failed to get the job done at last year's Melbourne Cup and this year's Cox Plate, but trainer Chris Waller believes its build-up is tracking perfectly.

item.title: The key takeaways from Anthony Albanese's time at ASEAN and APEC
item.description: While Australia's relationship with China has improved, there is still growing unease about Beijing's military power.

item.title: Monday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Angel Seafood halts oyster relocation amid protesters' algal bloom fears
item.description: A blockade at a boat ramp to prevent oysters from entering an open fishing bay, over fears of spreading the algal bloom, leads to the destruction of nearly $70,000 worth of oysters.

item.title: Woman concussed after south-east Queensland hit by giant hail
item.description: A Queensland small business owner was hospitalised with concussion after she "copped hailstones to the back of the head" at a community market.

item.title: O'Neil welcomes housing progress despite price surge, while Bragg says no to 'NIMBYs'
item.description: As the government comes under pressure for rising house prices in the first month of its expanded home deposit guarantee, Clare O'Neil welcomes signs of progress on supply.

item.title: Erin Patterson lodges appeal request in attempt to fight mushroom murder convictions
item.description: The triple-murderer lodges documents in Victoria's Court of Appeal requesting an appeal against her convictions.

item.title: Suspected meteor lights up Gippsland afternoon
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sale of WA's Yeeda Pastoral Company near Broome completed, NT abattoir tipped to reopen in 2026
item.description: The sale of Yeeda Pastoral Company, including the Kimberley Meat Company, to TLP4 Australian Holdings is now complete.

item.title: Canberra man avoids jail sentence over part in violent home invasion in ACT Supreme Court
item.description: Xiantao Shang went to an apartment seeking a woman who owed him money. When told she was not there, he and an accomplice forced their way in and assaulted the couple inside.

item.title: Students with disability isolated, unsupported in ACT public schools
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Delays plague Melbourne’s Fishermans Bend development
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Man charged with 10 counts of attempted murder after UK train stabbing
item.description: British prosecutors have charged a 32-year-old man with 10 counts of attempted murder after a mass stabbing on a London-bound train that left multiple passengers injured on Saturday, including two critically.

item.title: Corrections officers placed spit hood on Wayne Hunt, stripped him naked after seizure, coroner hears
item.description: A 56-year-old man was stripped naked, handcuffed and made to wear a spit hood after suffering a seizure inside prison, a coronial inquest into his death has heard.

item.title: Rosie's owner said despite the incident, she is happy and healthy.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man who shot poodle in Central Coast caravan park robbery sentenced to eight years in prison
item.description: A man who shot a dog in the face during a robbery on the Central Coast of New South Wales has been sentenced to eight years in prison.
